intro: Illecebrum sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian climbing plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are alternate, finely divided, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Illecebrum sibiricum is adapted to harsh environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
